rationale: In today's world smart grid, smart homes, smart water networks, intelligent transportation, smart infrastructure systems etc. Connect our world more than we ever thought possible. The common vision of such systems is usually associated with one single concept, the Internet of Things (IoT), where through the use of sensors, the entire physical infrastructure is closely coupled with information and communication technologies; where intelligent monitoring and management can be achieved via the usage of networked embedded devices. In this course the students will learn and explore the use and evolution of WSNs within the wider context of IoT and provide a review of WSN architecture framework, standards and IoT based Applications.
competency: Describe the fundamental principles of WSN and design application specific real-world IoT systems.

courseOutcomes.description: To demonstrate the fundamental architecture and key design issues in wireless sensor networks.
To enlist the various protocols and its differences with traditional protocols in WSNs.
To familiarize with conceptual framework of IoT.
To demonstrate architecture and design principle of IoT for real time applications.
To design and develop real time application specific IoT systems.

practicalExercises.description: To Simulate Wireless sensor network using open source educational simulation software.
To simulate and demonstrate LEACH protocol for WSN using open source educational simulation software.
Getting started with NodeMCU, Arduino with ESP8266 and ESP32 in the Arduino IDE.
GPIO Interfacing and programming (LED, Switch, Motor)
Digital on/off sensor (PIR and IR) Interfacing programming.
Controlling devices remotely using Bluetooth link.
Controlling devices remotely using Wi-Fi link.
Web based device control (Perform the practical to build a web server and control device from a local web server).
Getting started with different cloud system.
Analog sensor programming and uploading sensor data on cloud.
Interfacing and programming of actuators, Control devices remotely using cloud.
Introduction to raspberry pi and installing operating system for raspberry pi
Controlling relay state based on input from IR sensors using raspberry pi
Interfacing stepper motor with Raspberry Pi
Advanced burglar alarm security system with the help of PIR sensor, buzzer and keypad using raspberry pi. (Alarm gets disabled if correct keypad password is entered)
Automated LED light control based on input from PIR (to detect if people are present) and LDR (ambient light level)

specificationTable.unitTitle: Communication Protocols & Network management in WSNs
Architecture and Design Principles for IoT

hardware: Computer system with operating system: Windows 7 or higher Ver., macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM
Arduino Uno, Node MCU ESP32 & ESP8266

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Understand the choice and application of Wireless Sensor Network
Describe the fundamental architecture and design principles for IoT

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the overview of wireless sensor networks and enabling technologies for wireless sensor networks.
Discuss key challenges of designing application specific WSNs.

topics.title: Hardware Components
subtopics: 1.3.4 Prototypes (IMote, XYZ & Hog throb Node Architecture)

topics.title: Optimization Goals and Figures of Merit
Unique challenges and constraints in WSN

underpinningTheory.unitTitle: Communication Protocols & Network management in WSNs

unitOutcomes.description: Apply the design principles of WSN architectures and operating systems for simulating environment situations.
Apply various concepts for assignment of MAC addresses.
Select the appropriate infrastructure, topology, routing and relevant parameters for desired QoS in WSNs.

topics.title: Physical Layer and Transceiver Design Considerations
MAC Protocols for Wireless Sensor Networks
subtopics: 2.2.1 classification of MAC protocols for WSNs

topics.title: Low Duty Cycle Protocols And Wakeup Concepts i.e. S-MAC, IEEE 802.15.4
Address and Name Management in WSNs
Issues and Challenges in providing Quality of Service in WSNs

unitOutcomes.description: Understand the basic concept of IoT
Explain IoT Architecture and the major components of IoT

topics.title: Modified OSI Model for the IoT/M2M Systems

underpinningTheory.unitTitle: Architecture and Design Principles for IoT

unitOutcomes.description: Understand the protocols and their need in IoT
Able to interface with, controlling hardware, actuator, and sensors with NodeMCU/Raspberry Pi etc.

topics.title: Types of Sensors and actuators for IoT applications
IoT Protocols
subtopics: 4.3.4 Application layer protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, CoAP, MQTT, XMPP etc.

topics.title: Prototyping and Designing Software for IoT Applications
Block diagram & pin configuration of NodeMCU and Raspberry PI
Reading sensor data and transmit to cloud, Controlling devices through cloud using mobile application and web application
Broad categories of IoT applications: Consumer IoT, Commercial IoT, Industrial IoT, Infrastructure IoT, Military Things (IoMT)
Overview, Block Diagram and Working of the following real world IoT applications & case study
subtopics: 5.2.4 Smart City Street light control & Monitoring system

studentActivities: Give a seminar on any relevant topics
Visit any Industry with IoT in your area and learn the IoT systems used in Industry/Realtime applications
Students are encouraged to register themselves in various MOOCs to further enhance their learning
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics
About 10% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different Assessment methods
